question: In which one of the following cases the Supreme Court of India used the principle of “continuing mandamus”?
option1: S.P. Gupta Vs. Union of India
option3: Vineet Narain Vs. Union of India
option4: Sagir Ahmad Vs. State of U.P.
answer: Vineet Narain Vs. Union of India
explanation: Continuing Mandamus is a writ of Mandamus issued to a lower authority by the higher authority in general public interest asking the officer or the authority to perform its task expeditiously for an unstipulated period of time for preventing miscarriage of justice and it has been discussed and dealt with in the Vineet Narain v. Union of India Case.
